intro: Danthoniopsis chimanimaniensis, commonly known as the Chimanimani grass, is a perennial grass species native to the high-altitude regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Poaceae family and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky and well-drained soils, often in mountainous or forested areas. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear minute, wind-pollinated flowers. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
